title: Channel migrants being monitored over extremism fears
description: Migrants arriving in small boats are monitored daily by Britain’s security services due to concerns that terrorists and serious criminals are using the route as a backdoor into the UK, the former immigration minister has said.

title: UK economy: what does technical recession mean for Sunak?
description: Rishi Sunak pledged to kickstart growth. Instead, the UK fell into recession late last year. Output shrank for two consecutive quarters at the end of 2023 – with people spending less and doctor’s strikes contributing to the contraction.

title: Security services monitor Channel migrants over extremism fears
description: Robert Jenrick says 'border security is national security' as he urges Rishi Sunak again to take more urgent and 'robust' action

title: Civil servants want to work at home 2 days a week as Whitehall desperate for office return
description: The survey, conducted by Ranstad, found that civil servants, on average, want to spend just 2.1 days at their workplaces. Only one group - telecoms employees - would spend even less time in their offices, just two days on average.

title: PM faces ‘perfect storm of sh***ry’ with Budget his last chance, pollsters say
description: Next month’s Budget will mark the Conservative Party’s last chance to turn around its chances at the general election, with the Prime Minister facing a “perfect storm of shittery” later this week, polling experts have said.

title: Sunak's promise to get the economy growing 'has been completely broken'
description: He says the economy is smaller than it was when Prime Minister Rishi Sunak entered Downing Street in 2022.

title: Rishi Sunak's 'pet maths project' branded 'staggeringly expensive and inefficient'

title: Rishi Sunak warned against fresh austerity drive to finance tax cuts
description: Unions outraged as Jeremy Hunt said to be considering cutting public spending to balance books in next month’s budget

title: Nigel Farage blames Bank of England for UK recession as he blasts Andrew Bailey
description: Nigel Farage has blamed the Bank of England for Britain slipping into recession. The former Ukip leader pointed to the interest rate policy of the UK's central bank. He also branded Andrew Bailey the "worst governor of the Bank of England in our history".

title: Sunak braced for double poll blow as recession puts his economic plans ‘in tatters’
description: Labour taunt the prime minister that his promise to grow the economy is ‘in tatters’ as the UK slips into recession

title: Build houses where people actually want to live
description: The Tories have, he explained, done splendidly at building houses for people, their progress impeded only by Sadiq Khan, whose enthusiasm for bureaucracy is so intense that he is determined to deprive London’s young people of shelter.

title: What is Rishi’s recession and the fiscal ‘time bomb’ that awaits Labour?
description: With a nation of voters who have already decided, Sunak and Hunt have given up on winning the next election, writes Sean O’Grady. Instead, they are setting things up for Labour to fail

title: How a Tory opposition could look after the general election
description: Rishi Sunak is hoping the polls narrow before the election, but if they don't the Tories are facing a spell in opposition

title: Rishi Sunak welcomes King of Jordan to Downing Street
description: The Prime Minister welcomed the King of Jordan to Downing Street on Thursday, amid the ongoing conflict in the Middle East. Rishi Sunak greeted Jordan’s King Abdullah II on the steps of No 10, where a red carpet had been rolled out. The two men shook hands before heading inside where they posed for photographs in No 10’s White Room.

title: What does recession mean and how will it affect me?
description: Official confirmation of a recession will be yet another blow for prime minister Rishi Sunak, who made ‘grow the economy’ one of his five priorities when he became leader of the Conservatives. Liz McKeown, director of economic statistics at the ONS ...

title: How Is Rishi Sunak Doing On Those 5 Key Pledges He Made To Voters?
description: Barely two months after becoming prime minister, Rishi Sunak made five promises to voters on which he wanted to be judged. “No tricks, no ambiguity - we’re either delivering for you or we’re not,” the PM declared.

title: The Guardian view on the UK recession: no growth and no ideas either
description: Editorial: The Conservatives have presided over a shrunken British economy, and Rishi Sunak does not have a clue how to make it grow again

title: UK enters recession after steeper-than-expected fall in GDP
description: The recession is likely to be mild and short lived, with no major changes in the day to day life of consumers but it's bad news for Rishi Sunak who made growing the economy a key part of the Conservative's platform.

title: 'Never again can Rishi Sunak claim to have a plan when his plan is not working'
description: Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves said Rishi Sunak was 'taking the country backwards' after Britain sunk into recession at the end of last year - despite his vow to grow the economy

title: US fitness chain scraps disabled campaigner’s reasonable adjustments… then apologises for the ‘inconvenience’
description: A luxury US chain that suddenly removed the reasonable adjustments that allowed a disabled campaigner to take part in its “spin” fitness classes has been accused of breaching equality laws.

title: EUR/GBP Holds 0.85 Support As Data Sours The Sterling Rally
description: Thursday’s session started with a solid rally in risk assets. The German DAX made new all-time highs while the FTSE poked above 7600 with a gain of +0.5%. Dollar pairs were mostly higher, but the Pound dropped against the USD and the Euro, allowing EURGBP to recover to 0.855.

description: A YouGov survey of more than 4,000 people revealed 19 per cent of those who previously supported the Tories would switch to the party founded by Nigel Farage.

title: Zelenskyy will be in Paris Friday to sign bilateral security deal
description: PARIS — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will be in Paris on Friday to sign a bilateral security deal with France, the Elysée Palace announced today.

title: Small boat migrants are constantly monitored as ‘potential threats’ in ‘security emergency’, ex-minister says

title: Britain suffers longest hit to living standards since records began
description: Britain is suffering the longest hit to living standards on record, according to official figures that showed the economy is in recession. The Office for National Statistics (ONS) said output per person fell sharply at the end of last year, meaning the economy has failed to grow since early 2022 after accounting for population growth.

title: By-election polls updates: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer face a double electoral test in two previously safe Tory seats
description: RISHI Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer face a double electoral test today as voters go to the polls in two previously safe Tory seats.  The by-elections in Kingswood and Wellingborough will decide

title: UK economy fell into recession after people cut spending
description: The UK fell into recession during the final three months of last year, official figures show, after the economy shrank by more than expected. Gross domestic product (GDP) - a key measure of economic activity - dropped by 0.3% between October and December.

title: Rishi Sunak compares himself to Timothée Chalamet in comedic speech to Hollywood stars
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak embraced his inner comedian at the British Film Institute Chairman’s Dinner on Wednesday night (14 February). In a speech at the event, the PM compared himself to film star Timothée Chalamet, threw in his name to play the next James Bond, and took the opportunity to make a swipe at Boris Johnson.

title: NANA AKUA: Green meddlers' love of making life difficult has resulted in 13 different bins, streets strewn with rubbish... while half of 'recycled' plastic goes to landfill ...
description: I remember a time when I sorted my rubbish into just two bags: recycling and non-recycling. And each week, without fail, my friendly local binmen would take them away.

title: Over three million households trapped in fuel poverty
description: Data from the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero published today shows 13 per cent of English households – around 3.17 million – were in fuel poverty last year. These households possess an energy efficiency rating of band D or lower, with disposable incomes falling below the poverty line after housing and fuel expenses.

title: Rishi Sunak's 'grow the economy' pledge looks pretty silly now
description: But many of those in work have seen their living standards degraded by years of the cost of living running far ahead of pay increases. They feel the going is tough. Indeed GDP per head — perhaps a more accurate measure of people’s personal economic experience — fell in all four quarters last year.

title: Is it really 'Rishi's recession'?
description: The UK economy has been in by a series of economic shocks in recent years, none of which Rishi Sunak had any control over. He couldn’t have prevented COVID from reaching British shores and he can’t be held accountable for Russia’s decision to invade ...

title: More than three million households in fuel poverty in 2023, figures show
description: The figure would have been more than 3.5 million households in fuel poverty without Government support including energy bill payments and the cost-of-living income payments given to people on low incomes, the data showed.

title: Should a hairdresser be the next Chancellor?
description: This is all rather sad, especially when taken in the context of the other fresh revelation. It is highly commendable that both Rishi Sunak and Jeremy Hunt publish information about their tax liabilities. Many of their predecessors chose to keep the ...
